File signature verification
When signing a file with an electronic signature, the system can verify the signature according to the set settings.
Document signing is implemented by clicking on a button via a customized action, for example
"Sign the file using a simple e-signature"
.
Signature verification is configured via the parameters of the object type "File signing type" [FS_FILE_SIGN_KIND]:
Setting
Purpose
Name
Name of the signature type.
Identifier
Entering the unique identifier of the configuration object.
File re-signing settings
Lock a single signatory from signing a file multiple times
Feature that determines whether a file can be signed multiple times with one valid signature.
If the value is set to "No", the user will be able to sign the file with one valid signature several times.
If the "Yes" value is selected, the user will be able to sign the file with one signature only once.
Algorithm for calc time blocking the signature of a file with one certificate several times
Feature for blocking the ability of signing a file for a certain time.
The algorithm should determine the number of minutes during which re-signing of the file is prohibited. If working with multiple signatures, the user can sign the file for each of them.
The previously created algorithm is selected from the drop-down list, adding a new
algorithm
is available through the parameter actions menu.
The parameter is available when the "Lock a single signatory from signing a file multiple times" option is inactive.
File signature settings
File signature verification settings
Configuring verification of file signatures for revocation and qualification.
The values of the boolean parameters "Check the certificate for revocation", "Check the certificate for qualification" â€“ "Yes"/"No" are set in the settings data object, and the files of trusted root certificates are displayed/attached.
The previously created configuration object is selected from the drop-down list, adding a new object is available via the parameter actions menu.
Signature verification algorithm
Algorithm to set the signature verification condition.
The previously created algorithm is selected from the drop-down list, adding a new
algorithm
is available through the parameter actions menu.
The algorithm should return an object of the "Directory of e-signature verification results" type   [FS_FILE_SIGN_CHECK].
In objects of the "Directory of e-signature verification results" type, the text and background color of the signature verification are set, which are used when displaying information about signatures.

The display of information about signatures may be affected by changes in the values of the following parameters:
"E-signature verification result" is an object type of the"Directory of e-signature verification results" [FS_FILE_SIGN_CHECK], which defines the text and background color of the signature verification result.;
"Certificate qualified " is a boolean parameter that defines the caption in the signature header of the file.
When the value "Yes" is selected, "Certificate qualified" is displayed, when the value "No" or no value is set, "Certificate not qualified" is displayed.
